content:
Times Square is an iconic area in New York City, and there are plenty of amazing attractions within walking distance or a short subway ride away. Here are some popular attractions near Times Square:

**Walking Distance:**

1. **Broadway Theaters:** Catch a musical or play on Broadway, with many theaters located in the Theater District around Times Square.
2. **Madame Tussauds New York:** Get up close and personal with wax figures of your favorite celebrities and historical figures. (234 W 42nd St)
3. **Ripley's Believe It or Not!:** Explore the weird and wonderful at this iconic museum of oddities. (234 W 42nd St)
4. **Hershey's Chocolate World:** Indulge in chocolate treats and shop for souvenirs at this two-story candy store. (1593 Broadway)

**Short Subway Ride:**

1. **The Empire State Building:** Take in panoramic views of the city from the observation decks of this iconic skyscraper. (350 5th Ave, 10-min subway ride from Times Square)
2. **Grand Central Terminal:** Admire the stunning Beaux-Arts architecture and bustling atmosphere of this famous train station. (89 E 42nd St, 10-min subway ride from Times Square)
3. **The New York Public Library:** Explore the stunning Rose Main Reading Room and exhibitions at this iconic library. (476 5th Ave, 10-min subway ride from Times Square)
4. **Rockefeller Center:** Visit the Top of the Rock Observation Deck, NBC Studios, and the famous skating rink during winter. (45 Rockefeller Plaza, 10-min subway ride from Times Square)

**Other Attractions:**

1. **Central Park:** Take a stroll through this 843-acre green oasis, just a few blocks north of Times Square. (Enter at 59th St and 6th Ave)
2. **The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA):** Discover an extensive collection of modern and contemporary art. (11 W 53rd St, 15-min subway ride from Times Square)
3. **Bryant Park:** Relax in this charming park behind the New York Public Library, with plenty of food and drink options. (42nd St and 6th Ave)

These are just a few of the many attractions within walking distance or a short subway ride from Times Square. You can also consider purchasing a sightseeing pass, like the New York City Explorer Pass or the Sightseeing Pass, to save time and money on admission fees.

Enjoy your sightseeing adventures in New York City!
